principles.intensity: Start at 70-75% of 1 rep max for compound lifts, progressively increasing to 80-85% over 4-week training block
principles.progression: Increase load by 2.5-5 lbs on primary lifts weekly, focus on linear progression for major compound movements like squats, bench press, and deadlifts
principles.deload: Implement deload week every 4-5 weeks, reducing training volume by 40-50% and intensity to 50-60% of working weights to prevent overtraining and promote recovery

progression.week1: Foundation week: Focus on technique, moderate weight (65-70% 1RM), full body workouts 4x/week. Establish baseline strength and movement patterns.
progression.week2: Volume accumulation week: Increase total sets by 20%, introduce progressive overload. Target 3-4 sets per major movement pattern, slight weight increase.
progression.week3: Intensity peak week: Increase weight 5-7%, reduce rep range, focus on strength development. Lower volume, higher perceived exertion.
progression.week4: Deload week: Reduce volume by 40-50%, maintain technique, use 50-60% of previous weeks' weights. Active recovery and technique refinement.

restDays: Active recovery with light walking (20-30 minutes)
Mobility and flexibility work (yoga or dynamic stretching)
Low-intensity cross-training like swimming or cycling
recovery.sleep: 7-9 hours per night, maintain consistent sleep-wake cycle, prioritize sleep quality with dark, cool room
recovery.nutrition: High-protein meals (1.6-2.2g per kg body weight), balanced macronutrients, hydrate 3-4 liters daily, include post-workout protein and carbohydrate recovery meal
